availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. Indiana native. Son of William S. Unthank and Nancy L. Unthank. Married to Delia Evans Unthank in Louisville, Kentucky, on December 12, 1861. Resident of Cincinnati in 1850. Resident of Johnson County, Indiana, in 1860. Resident of Louisville in 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a captain from December 24, 1861, to July 19, 1862. Captured in Rutherford County, Tennessee, on June 7, 1862. Paroled December 20, 1862. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A) as a captain from November 4, 1863, to July 2, 1865. Captured in Bartow County, Georgia, on May 24, 1864. Escaped at Columbia, South Carolina, on December 18, 1864.
